dfischer.utils

Class LoadtestExternalResources

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.LoadtestExternalResources

  • public class LoadtestExternalResources
extends java.lang.Object
    Declarations of additional, external resources needed when executing a load test job. Typically such external resources are Java library files (*.jar files) which are used by plug-ins. However, also any other file types are supported.
     
    An external resource can be either located on the local system, meaning that it has to be transferred to the load generator as part of the load test job, or an external resource can also already be available (installed) on the "remote" load generator and has only to be declared for use.
     
    Note: "Input Files" and the "Main Class of Plug-Ins" are not external resources in this context because ZebraTester knows already their declarations.
    See Also:
    LoadtestExternalLocalResourcesDataRecord, LoadtestExternalRemoteResourcesDataRecord

      • addLocalFileResource

        public long addLocalFileResource(java.lang.String localFilePath,
                        boolean addToClassPath,
                        boolean addToXbootclasspath)
        Add (declare) a local resource that has to be transferred to the load generator.
        Parameters:
        localFilePath - absolute path to the local file
        addToClassPath - if set to true: add the file to the Java CLASSPATH on the load generator when executing a load test job
        addToXbootclasspath - if set to true: add the file to the Java -Xbootclasspath/p: on the load generator when executing a load test job
        Returns:
        the new unique ID of the added local resource.

      • modifyLocalFileResource

        public boolean modifyLocalFileResource(long localResourceId,
                              java.lang.String localFilePath,
                              boolean addToClassPath,
                              boolean addToXbootclasspath)
        Modify a local resource that has to be transferred to the load generator.
        Parameters:
        localResourceId - the unique ID of the local resource
        localFilePath - absolute path to the local file
        addToClassPath - if set to true: add the file to the Java CLASSPATH on the load generator when executing a load test job
        addToXbootclasspath - if set to true: add the file to the Java -Xbootclasspath/p: on the load generator when executing a load test job
        Returns:
        true if the local resource was modified, or false if no local resource with the specified ID was found.

      • removeLocalResource

        public void removeLocalResource(long localResourceId)
        Remove the declaration of a local resource.
        Parameters:
        localResourceId - the ID of the local resource

      • getLocalResource

        public LoadtestExternalLocalResourcesDataRecord getLocalResource(long localResourceId)
        Get the properties of a local resource addressed by the ID.
        Parameters:
        localResourceId - the ID of the local resource
        Returns:
        the properties of a local resource, or null if no local resource with the specified ID exists.

      • getLocalFileResource

        public LoadtestExternalLocalResourcesDataRecord getLocalFileResource(java.io.File f)
        Check if a local file is already declared and get the properties of the declared file.
        Parameters:
        f - any local file
        Returns:
        the properties of the local declared file, or null if no such file is declared
        Since:
        V5.4-S

      • getLocalFileResourceByPlainFileName

        public LoadtestExternalLocalResourcesDataRecord getLocalFileResourceByPlainFileName(java.lang.String plainFileName)
        Get the properties of a local file addressed by the plain file name.
        Parameters:
        plainFileName - the plain name of a local file (without any path)
        Returns:
        the properties of a local file addressed by the plain file name, or null if no corresponding file name is found. Note: the returned result is not unique if the same plain file name exists in several file paths. In such a case the properties of the first matching resource are returned.

      • getLocalFileResourcesFilePaths

        public java.lang.String[] getLocalFileResourcesFilePaths()
        Get the absolute file paths of all local files.
        Returns:
        the absolute file paths of all local files

        Get the plain file names of all local files.
        Returns:
        the plain file names of all local files

      • getLocalResources

        public LoadtestExternalLocalResourcesDataRecord[] getLocalResources()
        Get the properties of all local resources.
        Returns:
        the properties of all local resources, or an empty array in no local resources have been declared.

      • addRemoteFileResource

        public long addRemoteFileResource(java.lang.String remoteFilePath,
                         boolean addToClassPath,
                         boolean addToXbootclasspath)
        Add (declare) a remote resource that has to be used on the load generator.
        Parameters:
        remoteFilePath - absolute path of the remote file on the load generator (Exec Agent)
        addToClassPath - if set to true: add the file to the Java CLASSPATH on the load generator when executing a load test job
        addToXbootclasspath - if set to true: add the file to the Java -Xbootclasspath/p: on the load generator when executing a load test job
        Returns:
        the new unique ID of the added remote resource.
